channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ’Tis the Season for Trimming Travel Regulations
item.description: The best gift to fliers this holiday season would be to let the competitive airline marketplace do its thing.

item.title: Strengthening the Military Chaplain Corps Is a Win for Religious Liberty
item.description: A government institution charged with defending the Constitution shouldn’t marginalize religion itself. At long last, it won’t.

item.title: 'Too many redactions': Lawmakers say Epstein file release does not meet their requirements
item.description: Lawmakers said the Justice Department's release Friday of a limited and heavily redacted portion of its case files on Jeffrey Epstein violates the law...

item.title: Trump Has No Authority to Categorize Fentanyl as a Weapon of Mass Destruction
item.description: Common sense tells us that narcotic drugs are different from WMD. As one would expect, these differences are reflected in law.

item.title: China’s Alarming Latin America Strategy
item.description: A new paper reveals the essence of Beijing’s worldview: the entire world is one chessboard, and the Taiwan question is at its center.

item.title: A Stained Glass Christmas, from Chartres to Baltimore’s Gilded Age
item.description: ‘Like painting in air’ with colored light, John La Farge said of his church glass art.

item.title: 9th Circuit Protects Professor’s First Amendment Right To Make Fun Of Land Acknowledgments
item.description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the 9th Circuit ruled Friday that the University of Washington is not allowed to punish a professor for making fun of th...

item.title: Trump adds nine more Pharma companies to 'most favored nation' drug-pricing program
item.description: Another nine drug companies have hopped on board with President Trump's "Most Favored Nation" drug pricing program, bringing the total number of compa...

item.title: Chaplains Punished For Mentioning Jesus Cheer Hegseth’s Return To God-Focused Ministry
item.description: The chaplain brings God to the fight, offering something bigger for the soldier to hold on to. It is something an atheist can't offer.

item.title: Rep. Elise Stefanik drops out of New York's governor race, no reelection bid for House
item.description: Rep. Elise Stefanik has suspended her campaign for New York governorand said she will not be seeking reelection for her House seat, either.

item.title: Former President Clinton turns up in newly released 'Epstein files' -- in a hot tub
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton is seen in a hot tub, a swimming pool and seated close to a young woman on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's private jet, n...

item.title: Yes, Trump Pardoned 70-Year-Old Colorado Election Clerk, Gov. Polis Should Too
item.description: As Christians celebrate the birth of Jesus, Tina Peters' supporters call on Gov. Polis to reflect that spirit.

item.title: Wyoming GOP Sen. Lummis will not run for reelection
item.description: Sen. Cynthia Lummis, Wyoming Republican, announced Friday that she will not run for reelection in 2026, citing a "change of heart."

item.title: Will Amtrak Let The American Freedom Train Roll?
item.description: During America's bicentennial, seven million Americans visited John Wayne's 'Freedom Train' exhibit to celebrate America — but for America's 250th, le...

item.title: Contrary To The New York Times, Homeschooling Is Still A Much Better Alternative To Public Schools
item.description: Block claims to just want to protect children from abuse and neglect, but his nebulous ideas of what that means would put all homeschoolers at risk of...
